intro: Symplocarpus koreanus, commonly known as the Korean arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to Korea. It belongs to the Saururaceae family and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread vegetatively, contributing to its persistence in natural habitats. Symplocarpus koreanus is valued for its ornamental appearance and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
